page.title: 16ST.PETER'S CHURCH
page.content: This is almost certainly the church mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086, and it still retains its Saxon tower. It was closed in 1971 and taken over by the Department of the Environment. From 1978-1984 the grounds were excavated by the Humberside Archaeological Unit. It was discovered that layer upon layer of churches had been built on the site. Other interesting finds were some 10th century wooden coffins which had been preserved by the wet ground, hundreds of skeletons and several scaffolding holes which have provided valuable information about building techniques. Heating and lighting have recently been installed inside the church, and it is planned to open it to the public as an{ancient monument}in 1986.
